name: Cyber Threat Detection
description: Techniques for identifying and mitigating cyber threats in real-time environments.

cards.title: Threat Hunting & Anomaly Detection
cards.description: Proactively identifying cyber threats through network and system monitoring.
bulletpoints: Use AI and behavioral analytics to detect anomalies
Monitor for Indicators of Compromise (IoCs)
Deploy honeypots and deception techniques to track attackers
cards.summaryText: Hunt proactively with behavioral baselines, IoC sweeps, and lure infrastructure to flush attackers.

cards.title: Intrusion Prevention and Mitigation
cards.description: Blocking and mitigating cyber intrusions before they cause damage.
bulletpoints: Implement endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools
Use firewall rules and IDS/IPS for active threat mitigation
Monitor dark web forums for pre-attack planning intelligence
cards.summaryText: Layer EDR, tuned controls, and pre-attack intel scanning to slam doors on intruders.

cards.title: Static and Dynamic Malware Analysis
cards.description: Analyzing malware behavior to understand its impact and origin.
bulletpoints: Use tools like IDA Pro and Ghidra to reverse engineer binaries
Run malware in a sandbox (e.g., Cuckoo Sandbox) to analyze behavior
Extract IoCs from infected systems for threat attribution
cards.summaryText: Reverse binaries, sandbox live runs, and harvest IoCs to fingerprint malware campaigns.

cards.title: Phishing Email Analysis & Detection
cards.description: Identifying phishing emails and analyzing attack techniques.
bulletpoints: Extract header information and analyze email metadata
Use VirusTotal and Hybrid Analysis to check for malicious attachments
Reverse engineer phishing sites to uncover attacker infrastructure
cards.summaryText: Dissect headers, scan payloads, and tear down phishing kits to map attacker setups.

cards.title: OSINT for Cyber Threat Intelligence
cards.description: Leveraging open-source intelligence (OSINT) to track cyber threats.
bulletpoints: Use WHOIS and PassiveDNS to track attacker infrastructure
Monitor dark web marketplaces for leaked credentials and exploits
Use Maltego and SpiderFoot to map threat actor connections
cards.summaryText: Pivot through WHOIS, dark markets, and link analysis to chart open-source threat intel.

cards.title: Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Log Analysis
cards.description: Using SIEM tools to detect and investigate cyber threats.
bulletpoints: Analyze logs in Splunk, ELK, or Graylog for suspicious activity
Correlate events across multiple systems to identify breaches
Set up automated alerts for privilege escalation and data exfiltration
cards.summaryText: Mine SIEM data, chain cross-system events, and alert on privilege spikes to catch breaches fast.

cards.title: Detecting DNS Tunneling Attacks
cards.description: Identifying and mitigating covert data exfiltration through DNS queries.
bulletpoints: Monitor for unusually long DNS queries and subdomain requests
Use machine learning to detect abnormal DNS traffic patterns
Block unauthorized DNS resolvers and enforce strict DNS filtering
cards.summaryText: Flag odd DNS shapes, score them with ML, and clamp resolvers to kill tunneling.

cards.title: Ransomware Detection and Response
cards.description: Identifying and mitigating ransomware attacks before encryption spreads.
bulletpoints: Monitor file system changes for rapid encryption activity
Use YARA rules to detect ransomware signatures
Implement network segmentation to isolate infected systems
cards.summaryText: Watch for mass encryption, trigger YARA hits, and segment fast to blunt ransomware spread.

cards.title: Zero-Day Exploit Tracking
cards.description: Monitoring and mitigating threats from undisclosed vulnerabilities.
bulletpoints: Use CVE tracking tools like Vulners and ExploitDB
Monitor threat intelligence feeds for zero-day exploit activity
Apply virtual patching to mitigate risks before vendor updates
cards.summaryText: Track CVEs and feeds, then drop virtual patches to bridge zero-day exposure windows.

cards.title: AI-Driven Cyber Threats & Detection
cards.description: Understanding AI-generated attacks and how to defend against them.
bulletpoints: Monitor for adversarial AI and automated phishing attacks
Analyze AI-generated malware and polymorphic threats
Deploy AI-powered defenses for real-time attack mitigation
cards.summaryText: Spot AI-crafted attacks, study polymorphic shifts, and counter with adaptive defensive models.

cards.title: Dark Web Monitoring for Threat Intelligence
cards.description: Tracking cybercriminal activities on the dark web.
bulletpoints: Use Tor search engines to identify leaked credentials and exploits
Monitor dark web forums for attack planning discussions
Cross-reference leaked data with known breach records
cards.summaryText: Sweep hidden markets, read planning chatter, and tie leaks back to known breaches.

cards.title: Detecting Command & Control (C2) Communications
cards.description: Identifying and disrupting malware command-and-control activity.
bulletpoints: Monitor network traffic for beaconing behavior
Analyze HTTP, DNS, and HTTPS-based C2 channels
Use behavioral analytics to detect stealthy persistent C2 connections
cards.summaryText: Trace beacon cadence, parse multi-protocol C2, and lean on behavior models to cut command links.

cards.title: Cloud Security Threat Monitoring
cards.description: Detecting security risks in cloud environments.
bulletpoints: Monitor AWS CloudTrail, Azure Security Center, and Google Cloud Logging
Identify misconfigured storage buckets and API key leaks
Use cloud SIEM solutions to detect unauthorized access
cards.summaryText: Watch cloud audit trails, close misconfig gaps, and alert on rogue access across providers.

cards.title: Insider Threat Detection and Mitigation
cards.description: Identifying and preventing threats from within an organization.
bulletpoints: Monitor user behavior analytics (UBA) for privilege misuse
Detect unusual data transfers and unauthorized access attempts
Implement role-based access controls (RBAC) and strict logging policies
cards.summaryText: Use UBA to catch misuse, flag data leaks, and tighten RBAC with airtight logging.

cards.title: Threat Actor Profiling and Attribution
cards.description: Tracking cybercriminal groups and nation-state actors.
bulletpoints: Analyze Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) from APT reports
Use MITRE ATT&CK framework for threat actor profiling
Map threat group activity to known malware campaigns
cards.summaryText: Profile actors via TTPs, align to MITRE matrices, and link activity to recurring campaigns.
